intro: Centaurea somchetica, commonly known as the Somchet's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its vibrant blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
